Package gov.va.med.srcalc.domain.model

Domain objects representing risk models.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DiscreteVariable
    A Variable whose value is one of a discrete set.
    ModelTermVisitor
    Gang-of-Four Visitor pattern for ModelTerms.
    Variable
    A model variable.
    VariableVisitor
    Gang-of-Four Visitor pattern.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractNumericalVariable
    Implements base properties (valid range and units) for Variable that has a numerical value.
    AbstractVariable
    Implements base properties for Variable.
    BooleanTerm
    A ModelTerm for a BooleanVariable.
    BooleanVariable
    A Variable with Boolean (yes/no) value.
    ConstantTerm
    A constant term.
    DerivedTerm
    A ModelTerm derived via a Rule.
    DiscreteNumericalVariable
    A Variable that ultimately represents one of a finite, discrete set of values.
    DiscreteNumericalVariable.Category
    A Category for a DiscreteNumericalVariable.
    DiscreteTerm
    A ModelTerm related to a particular option of a DiscreteVariable.
    DisplayNameComparator
    Compares Variables (case-insensitively) by their display names.
    ExceptionlessVariableVisitor
    Base class for a VariableVisitor that doesn't throw any exceptions.
    ModelTerm
    A single summation term in a risk model.
    MultiSelectOption
    An option for a MultiSelectVariable.
    MultiSelectVariable
    A Variable that allows selection from one of multiple discrete options.
    NumericalRange
    A mathematical interval, that is, a set of real numbers between two real numbers.
    NumericalTerm
    A ModelTerm for a NumericalVariable.
    NumericalVariable
    A Variable with numerical (floating-point) value.
    Procedure
    Represents a medical procedure, particuarly a CPT code.
    ProcedureTerm
    A ModelTerm for a ProcedureVariable.
    ProcedureVariable
    Similar to a MultiSelectVariable, but the selections are a procedure list.
    RiskModel
    A risk model definition.
    Rule
    Encapsulates a configured rule to use in a model calculation, such as "multiply the age by a coefficient if the patient is totally dependent" or "add a constant to the sum if the patient's current weight is less than 90% of her weight 6 months ago."
    Rule.EvaluationContext
    The context in which to evaluate a Rule.
    RuleDisplayNameComparator
    Compares Rules by their display names.
    SingleVariableTerm
    A ModelTerm that uses a single Variable.
    Specialty
    Represents a surgical specialty, with the associated calcuation variables.
    ValueMatcher
    An object which evaluates a Value to true or false using a Spring Expression Language (SPeL) expression.
    VariableGroup
    Represents a group of Variables, usually for display grouping.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    MultiSelectVariable.DisplayType
    Enumerates the possible ways a MultiSelectVariable may be displayed to a user.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    InvalidValueException
    Indicates that a given value is invalid for a given Variable.
    MissingValuesException
    Indicates that value(s) were required for one or more variables but were not available.
    ValueTooHighException
    Indicates that a given value was too high for a given Variable.
    ValueTooLowException
    Indicates that a given value was too low for a given Variable.

Package gov.va.med.srcalc.domain.model Description

Domain objects representing risk models. Includes:
  • Variables (e.g., age, gender)
  • Rules (e.g., an interaction between age and pneumonia)
  • Terms (e.g., age multiplied by a coefficient)
  • Procedures
  • the Models themselves (e.g., Thoracic 30-day Mortality)
  • Specialties (e.g., Thoracic)
  • and supporting classes
